channel.title: Does MySQL functionality work in MoparClassic?

item.title: Does MySQL functionality work in MoparClassic?
item.dc:creator: @cleako cleako
item.description:
@cleako wrote:

github.com/MoparClassic/MoparClassic

Issue: MySQL user needs created if it doesn't exist

opened by moparisthebest on 2012-03-16
closed by Rodgerwilco on 
When using DummyAuth, or WebsiteAuth for example, the user is authorized but login fails because they don't exist in the MySQL...

Read full topic
item.source: Does MySQL functionality work in MoparClassic?

item.title: Does MySQL functionality work in MoparClassic?
item.dc:creator: @sin sin
item.description:
@sin wrote:

Hey guys I have the Auth.php working and the database storage set to MySQL but it never creates a new user so there is never anything in the database although it’s set to create a new user and should trigger the mysql registerPlayer function. Has anyone ever had this working?

I always get the return code 6, which says the player is banned. In PlayerLoginHandler it seems to skip over this part

if (!Server.storage.playerExists(user)) {
if (Config.AUTO_REGISTER) {
PlayerSave p = Server.storage.registerPlayer(user, pass, DataConversions.hashToUsername(user));
Server.storage.savePlayer§;
} else {
return 10;
}
}

without creating the Player in the MySQL database

Read full topic
item.source: Does MySQL functionality work in MoparClassic?
